result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Ramont Gaston

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Kohl's Department Stores.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Reginald Ramont Gaston not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Reginald Ramont Gaston.  Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Initial appearance is not held. Defendant is not produced. For reasons stated on the record, case is called to address bail only. Court found probable cause for the purpose of setting bail. Court adjourned matter for an Initial Appearance in Out of Custody Court.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
